intro: Alsinanthus ciliatus, commonly known as the fringed salsify, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many mustard plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Alsinanthus ciliatus is typically found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
